title: No option to disable connection bar in RDP
author: bpsib
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
I can't find an option to disable the RDP connection bar from showing when moving the mouse cursor to the top while it's full screen. This gets extremelly annoying when using a touch screen because it appears and gets in the way every time I touch the screen. It's not fit for purpose for me without this option.

## Your Environment
<!--- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->
*...

iterations.description: RDP connection bar visibility is controllable via MSTSCLib AdvancedSettings2.DisplayConnectionBar; exposing it as a per-connection boolean property is a straightforward enhancement.

notes:
AI triage (claude): RDP connection bar visibility is controllable via MSTSCLib AdvancedSettings2.DisplayConnectionBar; exposing it as a per-connection boolean property is a straightforward enhancement.
Approach: Add a bool ConnectionBar property to ConnectionInfo, apply it via AdvancedSettings2.DisplayConnectionBar in RdpProtocolHandler before connecting, and expose it in the connection properties panel.
